I agree, maybe also add more use to leather

I just got into setting up farms in my Survival mode, and I've been having trouble with having too much leather armor. An option to turn them back into leather would be great, especially using shears (which don't seem to have much use outside of getting wool and making jack-o-lanterns).
I think you should get the shears back, as long as they don't break.
Good Idea I hope the devs see it but they are hard at work

I love recycling my items and "junk" loot in this game and I believe this game could use more recycling not only as an environmental message but to help us declutter chest. De-crafting our Leather armor & Horse armor into regular Leather similar to how you can already recycle Iron/Gold armor and tools from mob loot is a great way to acquire excess Iron and Gold for other projects. Players could smelt rails to iron nuggets to turn items the player don't want or don't use into ones they do like turning rail iron nuggets into redstone components. Not every player wants the same thing.

I hope this would apply to not only Leather armor but Diamond armor too so we may recycle out end city and ancient city loot. The issue is that once you acquire a ton of good sets of armor, you have no need for extra sets. Being able to turn diamond armor/tools into diamond shards and craft those up into diamonds would enable diamond blocks and all diamond made items to be renewable (especially with villagers) this way we can build with diamond blocks easier once we're end-game.

I thing getting one for one leather would be too much. Maybe have a new item like leather scraps, kinda like the gold and iron nuggets , that you can then craft into leather.  

Being able to use leather items as fuel would also be nice.
I was just looking on google for a means to use leather armour drops and was sad to see there's no solution in-game as of yet. Would absolutely love an idea like this to be implemented!

I see this working, but comparing how iron and golden armor gives you nuggets I think decrafting leather armor should give you rabbit hide, this way it doesnt make it seem cheap and balance early game a lil bit
The crossbow doesn't need the bow enchantments. It is strong enough already. If you craft fireworks with seven firework stars, they are way stronger than normal.

Still weaker than a power V bow though, so I agree with Zig. Power V bow does 12.5 hearts of damage, firework with 7 stars only does 8.25 hearts.

They should balance the bow and crossbow out, if they decide not to add bow enchants to the crossbow, then add an enchant called guiding, which will make a projectile home towards the nearest target in a 5 block radius, greatly increasing the crossbow’s accuracy.
Even if they don't add it to survival it could be nice if they add it for map makers.

I definitely agree with this; Power & Infinity should easily be applicable and as said by sP4ZoR4Ma: Currently, none have any effect via command application, which is a complete waste for map makers. The more crossover there are among the lesser specific enchantments the better, in my personal opinion.

As for Flame, Punch, Piercing, Quick Charge and Multishot, I would add either Piercing or Quick Charge to the bow, but keep Punch and Flame exclusive. The reason for this is that there would be an equal number of exclusive enchantments. Piercing & Punch would of course not work well together, and would require to be mutually exclusive like Silk Touch & Mending. I would however lean towards adding Quick Chage to the bow because, while the crossbows deal more damage than bows, the downside should still be that a bow can be loaded quicker than a crossbow. Either way; I don't see why all of these should not work on both when applied via commands.

I both agree and disagree with this thread:

 

Although using a crossbow without multishot and a 7-star firework still falls short of a bow, having multishot and the firework instakills mobs and works well for crowd control as well. If close enough you can kill multiple mobs too. 

Having infinity would be OP such that you can basically have a down-graded version of this with piercing and multishot. With multishot, you can aim such that only the side arrows hit mobs and whereas the middle does not. With piercing (as ling as it's not a gigantic group) you can retrieve the arrow 9 times outta 10. Having infinity would just be too much. Quite frankly arrows aren't hard to come by and with mob farms, the crafting recipe, and simply that it's mutually exclusive with mending, infinity just becomes obsolete.

Power, yeah crossbows should have it, but maybe not up to 5. As stated by someone else previously, the crossbow is primarily for crowd control and having it one-shot multiple mobs with multishot and piercing may be a bit much. Maybe add a new enchantment that goes up to 2 that's like power but doesn't insta-kill multiple mobs. Or make it where power can only go up to 2 on crossbows.

Punch would be great because if you're dealing with crowds you can at least lighten the group of mobs or simply knock back multiple players at once. 

Flame should be exclusive to bows, having it on crossbows would be just plain unbalanced!

 

While I do agree that some changes are in order, I think the crossbow has plenty going for it as it is and I wouldn't be too disgruntled if no changes came. ut it would be nice for some no flavor to them as well!

 

What do you guys think?

i found that using anvil you can enchant crossbow with power or flame, but it does nothing as the arrow does nor make fire, nor have better range/damage and honestly we really need power enchantment since if not its just a shotgun with little bullets

I agree, but instead of adding the bow enchantments, they should add a new enchantment for the crossbow, maybe one that is able to load multiple arrows at a time into a crossbow, allowing you to fire multiple arrows with out having to reload. This wouldn't be like Multishot, where you fire multiple arrows at once, but instead you are able to fire individual arrows without having to reload, and it would be mutually exclusive with Multishot

Hey, I hate to be a necromancer but i feel that this thread has missed a very glaring oversight. Some people say “no, it’d be too unbalanced or too OP” and to that i say. . . good. . . it SHOULD be more powerful than a bow. Think about it, why is the weapon with the cheaper recipe just outright better than the more expensive recipe??? Like imagine if the stone sword was stronger than the iron sword. How the hell would that make sense?

A bow is made out of 3 string, 3 sticks. Essentially just a fishing pole with an extra string. Most common items for an end-game item recipe. You can easily get theses before your first bed in a new world. Now lets look at the cross bow: 4 sticks, 2 string, 1 plank and 2 iron ingots OR 3 sticks, 2 string 1 iron ingot and 1 spare trip wire if you happen to have one laying around (and lets be honest, you never do so you gotta make one).

How are we spending more to make less??? That just sounds like unbalanced economics to me. If you ask me, I’m willing to take it to the extremes and say that bow needs to be nerfed with the crossbow getting what the normal bow lost. The bow should outright be the lesser weapon if we base things off of recipe economics, which we should since thats what defines an items equivalent to cost. Legit, why is this STARTER weapon also the end game weapon. The ramp is backwards here. As i said before, imagine if a wooden pick could mine everything the iron pick could but the iron pick could only mine cobblestone and coal.
I would like to see Flame being accessible for Crossbows; however, instead of adding Power to them, I would make that Piercing increases damage by 25%, like Power

It's a clever idea, but not something I'd get excited about.  It seems like a lot of extra work to code and remember all the items that happened to despawn in that body of water just for a tiny bit of immersion.

Uhm... Just… NO! .  From how I've seen people play on realms, I wouldn't want their despawned stuff!  I get chestloads of junk as it is /0\.

 

Actually, I think someone has been tinkering with fishing over the last couple of updates o-o

It used to be well balanced but now its a time hog.  Perhaps luck of the sea has been altered or bugged? maxed enchantments were operating like unenchanted / low enchanted. My observations were pre-aquatic and since the full aquatic release, lure now seems to work properly in that I can see a speed increase but I think I'm going to have to take it on a full test drive to check that the balance is actually restored.  Watch this space...

Ok, so I'm half way through my less than scientific initial scan and there is definitely a change for the worst.  It seems as if some people can't add new items and resist the temptation to start 'tinkering' (ok, so its a team - or many teams - or just random individuals - or.... 'random segments of code...' 0.0 ). 

Either way, the quality of treasure HAS decreased under luck of the sea while the junk appears to be around the same or slightly static across the levels.  One would expect higher levels of good high level treasure associated higher luck of the sea and lower levels (and more junk) at lower levels to no luck of the sea.

My initial worry on the lure rate seems unfounded.  I'll post back if any change.  

I'll be sampling for a little while longer and do another big session somewhere along the way.   I'll post my observations here.

Throwing sugar into a river should - for example - dissolve it, and fish would be set free again - is this what you mean? I agree. I even would go so far to remove it from the inventory once you take a dive, if it wasn´t put into a safe container (ender chest/ shulker box ...

Okay, so, on the one hand, finding the diamonds that accidentally fell into the lava would be grand. On the other hand.... the stacks and stacks and stacks and stacks of cobble, dirt, gravel, and other mining runoff would be intolerable. Or the stone hoes and pickaxes people throw away because they've moved on to iron or diamond... it would kind of destroy the joy of fishing. I'm afraid I just can't get on board with this one...

Amazing idea, especially when you have overworld dungeons or fortresses that are thousands of blocks away, it's better to portal near them through the nether.

This is really good
This would work only if the target portal is within specific range.

I agree with this idea, however I think it should only work for portals that are within a certain radius of eachother.  If they can be connected from any distance, it would limit the need for current travel options like elytra, horses, and ice highways, and take away from some features the game already has.

However, this still is a much needed feature, because currently if more than one person builds a base near each other that have two different portals, the portals are forced to connect to each other, which is not only inconvenient, it seriously limits the creative ability one can use when making things with portals.

Want to make a cool hidden base under spawn that you can only get to via a portal?  You can't.

Want to make a system of portals that results in a maze connecting both the overworld and nether?  You can't unless you make it extremely spread out, or only use a single portal. 

Want to simply build a nice nether portal near your base that happens to lead to a different room in your nether base?  You can't.

This would be an extremely nice feature to have and would greatly increase the creative expression one has when building things in the nether.
This would definitely be very useful when you need to travel somewhere far away and be able to get back.
This is very good for fast traveling

Nuclear power is something of which, as a general rule in life overall, I am greatly in favor...

But in Minecraft? Well, okay let me get into my thought process with you.

We gotta talk about What Nuclear Materials DO: They make heat. Lots of it. You may as well call it magic. If you described a magical material that makes a TON OF HEAT ALL THE TIME and also destroys molecular bonds of stuff close to it, a scientist would say "Oh, so it's radioactive!" First and foremost, above and beyond every other aspect of what radiation is and what it does, this is the most readily apparent, useful, and actionable immediate effect.

What does heat DO for us, in Minecraft?

* Cooks food,
* Smelts ores,
* Bakes clay,
* Melts iron/gold stuff into nuggets,
* Vitrifies sand to Glass

In Real Life, heat is used to cook, smelt, glaze, melt, and bake as well, THEN make electricity. Power plants (Coal, Oil, and Gas etc) are all just big'ol Steam Engines that boil water, making high pressure steam ready to spray out very hard through turbines, thus spinning them, moving magnets through coils of wire, which is what generates electric current.

Before we can apply the heat of nuclear power toward making electricity, there must first be an infrastructure for using HEAT ITSELF that way. And as it stands, Minecraft doesn't seem to have a need for a mechanic like electricity; It would render EVERYTHING in the game presently redundant. Mods do it better.

Nuclear power is too advanced to have in Minecraft, as Minecraft's technology is more at the Middle Ages stage. And besides, there is a lot of controversy over nuclear power.

-GirlyCraft12

I like this idea, but I think you should get more nuggets. I agree the durability should decrease the amount you get. A breastplate (gold or iron) takes 8 ingots and 1 ingot is the same as 9 nuggets, so each breastplate costs 8*9 = 72 nuggets to craft. In the same vein other pieces of armour, weapons and tools cost the following amounts: boots 36, helmet 45, leggings 63, sword 18, shears 18, hoe 18, axe 27, pickaxe 27, shield 9 and shovel 9.

I think you should get half the material you used to craft it, minus the percentage of durability lost, in nugget form. So smelting a breastplate with full durability gets you 72/2 - (72/2 * 0%) = 36 nuggets, or 4 ingots. Smelting a breastplate at half durability gives you 72/2 - (72/2 * 50%) = 18 nuggets, or 2 ingots. Smelting a sword at 10% durability gives you 18/2 - (18/2 * 90%) = 9 - 8.1 = 0.9 nuggets, rounded down to 0.

This would prevent gold farms in the nether from giving you too much gold through dropped gold swords, but would let you get back material if you didn't use it.

I can sneak, I can sneak a little faster. Just like I could IRL (not like this game is realistic in the first place, but thats besides the point)

I don't think that "fixing" this bug is that great of an idea because someone that has played thousands of hours probably won't have it fun trying to get used to the new changes. It used to feel fluid and now it feels just slow and janky. 

I never even thought this was a bug but I had a feeling it wasn't 100% intentional. Even so, we have had it this way for so long and I don't think that many peaple will like it this way. If this is not changed before the next update this post will get way more votes and that almost garanteed.

Please Microsoft/Mojang just make this an intended feature instead.
It also affects sprint jumping into the elytra so its even worse

The sudden clunkiness of ground movement with the elytra was very jarring to me with this update and I was confused on why my sprint was being reset all the time.
I was really disappointed when I looked into it and saw elytra was affected by this patch.
I had almost 8 years of muscle memory built up for sprint jumping with the elytra to optimize ground movement.

This has never been the behavior for elytra. Since the introduction of elytra in 1.9 (long before the sprint sneak bug MC-152728 was introduced in 1.14.2) it has always retained your sprint if you were sprinting before entering a flying state.
It is my belief that elytra were misclassified as affected by the MC-15272 bug when they should not have been.
The logic used in the bug report is that the you cannot start a sprint during elytra flight, therefore you should not be able to retain sprint. However, this logic does not take into account the ramifications for player movement this change causes. Unlike the other player states (such as eating) there was also no advantage to sprinting during the elytra flight itself, as flight speed was never impacted by sprinting. This change has nerfed the usefulness of the elytra compared to it's launch state.
Removal of these mechanics do nothing to help the game and actively hinder skilled players while providing no benefit for unskilled ones. Mojang plz fix
